intro: Microtropis kotoensis, commonly known as the Koto's microtropis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats, such as under forest canopies. Its botanical features include compound leaves with ovate leaflets and small, inconspicuous fruits. It is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological traits.
